amendment.description: Amendment sought to reduce the appropriation for the National Endowment for the Arts by $10 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 72 in the Congressional Record of July 13, 1995, to reduce funding for the National Endowment for the Arts by $10 million, from $99.5 million to $89.5 million. The intent of the amendment would be to phase out the NEA over two years rather than three years.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Stearns amendment (A019) Failed by recorded vote: 179 - 227 (Roll no. 512).
